ygData.subject: Re: Overlearning
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, Richard, Overlearning is a general problem in ANN s training so if someone could solve it he would be worth given a medal :) You can find information in

Hi, Richard,

Overlearning is a general problem in ANN's training so if som=
eone 
could solve it he would be worth given a medal :) You can find 
infor=
mation in papers and books that ANNs with compact structures are 
good gene=
ralizators, but, in my opinion, this question is still open 
because there =
are papers with right opposite results and in real tasks 
in most cases nob=
ody can tell your apriory exactly what structure will 
be the best. This is=
 just because separation bounds of different 
classes are unknown and in la=
rge ANNs extra neurons can be used to 
stabilize "working" neurons. There a=
re some results from statistical 
learning theory concerning toplogical com=
plexity of ANN, for example 
VCDim (Vapnik-Chervonenkis's Dimension):

2[K/=
2]N <=3D VCDim <=3D 2N_w(1+lg{N_n}),

where [] -- means convertion to integ=
er, K -- numer of nodes in hidden 
layer, N -- dimension of input vector, N=
_w -- overall number of 
weights in ANN, N_n -- overall number of neurons.
=

But this is a heuristic for SVM and RBF. Moreover VCDim doesn't 
consider =
shorcut connections which tend to appear in result of NEAT or 
another NE a=
lgorithms that search topology of ANN without strict 
constraints. I'm sure=
 that there should be novel mathematical results 
in this field but I suspe=
ct they don't solve the whole problem due to 
great variety of tasks and un=
certainity of data in many of them.

Anyway, you can try early stopping tec=
hnique. For this a validation 
set of data is needed (in addition to traini=
ng and test sets). You can 
form validation set simply by picking some samp=
les from training set 
and some samples from the test set. But ensure that =
resulting 
training, validation and test sets are representative enough for=
 
competent learning.

The early stopping implementation have the following=
 steps:
1. ANN training for N generations using training data set.
2. Valid=
ation of current population using validation set. If average 
fitness is no=
t worse than after the training step than proceed to Step 
1 otherwise we c=
onsider that ANN is overfitting the training data and 
proceed to Step 3.
3=
. Stop

Good luck,
Yury

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Richard Gong" <gongr=
ichard@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
> 
> I'm not sure how to prevent NEAT from overt=
raining. Are there any 
ideas about this? Thanks a lot.
> 
> -Richard
>
